intro: Eschscholzia minutiflora subsp. covillei, commonly known as the Coville's dwarf poppy, is a small annual plant native to the western United States. It features delicate, bright orange to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and grows to a height of only a few inches. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within the Papaveraceae family.
